thread.title: FIFA to decide by next week on crisis meeting while Blatter appeals
thread.title_full: FIFA to decide by next week on crisis meeting while Blatter appeals

title: FIFA to decide by next week on crisis meeting while Blatter appeals
text:
FIFA to decide by next week on crisis meeting while Blatter appeals REUTERS ADD A MESSAGE YOUR E-MAIL 
FIFA's executive committee is likely to decide next week whether to hold an emergency meeting following the suspension of president Sepp Blatter, a spokesperson said on Friday. Blatter, due to step down in February, was suspended for 90 days by FIFA's ethics committee on Thursday along with UEFA president Michel Platini as part of a corruption investigation shaking world football's governing body. Platini had been the frontrunner to win the election to replace Blatter and his shrinking hopes now depend on whether he can overturn the ban through an appeal process. Both men deny suggestions of an improper payment by the FIFA head to Platini in 2011. Meanwhile, Sepp Blatter has filed an official appeal against his suspension from football by FIFA's ethics committee, the New York Times reported. The New York Times said it had obtained a copy of Blatter's appeal against the suspension. In it, the paper reported that Blatter objected to brusque and unfair treatment.
